intro: Rubus divergens f. luebeckii, commonly known as the Lübeck raspberry, is a botanical variant of the common raspberry. It is a shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small, bright red drupes. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and hedgerows. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Rubus genus.
